title: (x) "Woods beyond a Cornfield" handtooled serif face - Monotype Old Style {Mircea Croitor}
content:
I need some help identifying the typeface which the book's title—'Woods beyond a cornfield-is set in. The book was printed by hand letterpress in London, in 1979 and I know the printer-publisher used mainly Monotype or special Foundry typefaces. Any help (and info on the typeface if possible) would be GREATLY appreciated! Thanks in advance!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [WBAC\_TP.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027181541/http:/typophile.com/files/WBAC_TP.jpg) | 401.34 KB |
author: rathna

comments.content:
Collinge & Clark has this book listed on abe.com and they call the display face Bold Face Outline. I assume they are taking that from the colophon.

Gerald

Thanks very much! There's nothing on the colophon. But I put Gerald's and Cromy's comments together and managed to figure it out. There's no 'Bold Face Outline' but this did ring a bell with an article I read on the publisher a while ago. Cromy's clue provided the final link - I managed to unearth a copy of the Monotype Printing Types Specimen Book. The type in question is Monotype Old Style Bold Outline 176. See image attached with great many thanks for all the help!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141027181541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/oldstyle001_5467.jpg)
